description: This class represents equivalent injections (generation or load).  Voltage regulation is allowed only at the point of connection.

contents.name: ConductingEquipment_BaseVoltage
contents.description: All conducting equipment with this base voltage.  Use only when there is no voltage level container used and only one base voltage applies.  For example, not used for transformers.

contents.name: Equipment_EquipmentContainer
contents.description: Container of this equipment.

contents.name: Equipment_aggregate
contents.description: The single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modeled together as an aggregate.  Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modeled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  This is not to be used to indicate equipment that is part of a group of interdependent equipment produced by a network production program.

contents.name: EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentNetwork
contents.description: The associated reduced equivalents.

contents.name: EquivalentInjection_ReactiveCapabilityCurve
contents.description: The equivalent injection using this reactive capability curve.

contents.name: EquivalentInjection_maxP
contents.description: Maximum active power of the injection.

contents.name: EquivalentInjection_maxQ
contents.description: Used for modeling of infeed for load flow exchange. Not used for short circuit modeling.  If maxQ and minQ are not used ReactiveCapabilityCurve can be used.

contents.name: EquivalentInjection_minP
contents.description: Minimum active power of the injection.

contents.name: EquivalentInjection_minQ
contents.description: Used for modeling of infeed for load flow exchange. Not used for short circuit modeling.  If maxQ and minQ are not used ReactiveCapabilityCurve can be used.

contents.name: EquivalentInjection_p
contents.description:
Equivalent active power injection. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
Starting value for steady state solutions.

contents.name: EquivalentInjection_q
contents.description:
Equivalent reactive power injection. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
Starting value for steady state solutions.

contents.name: EquivalentInjection_r
contents.description:
Positive sequence resistance. Used to represent Extended-Ward (IEC 60909).
Usage : Extended-Ward is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange.

contents.name: EquivalentInjection_r0
contents.description:
Zero sequence resistance. Used to represent Extended-Ward (IEC 60909).
Usage : Extended-Ward is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange.

contents.name: EquivalentInjection_r2
contents.description:
Negative sequence resistance. Used to represent Extended-Ward (IEC 60909).
Usage : Extended-Ward is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange.

contents.name: EquivalentInjection_regulationCapability
contents.description: Specifies whether or not the EquivalentInjection has the capability to regulate the local voltage.

contents.name: EquivalentInjection_regulationStatus
contents.description: Specifies the default regulation status of the EquivalentInjection.  True is regulating.  False is not regulating.

contents.name: EquivalentInjection_regulationTarget
contents.description: The target voltage for voltage regulation.

contents.name: EquivalentInjection_x
contents.description:
Positive sequence reactance. Used to represent Extended-Ward (IEC 60909).
Usage : Extended-Ward is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange.

contents.name: EquivalentInjection_x0
contents.description:
Zero sequence reactance. Used to represent Extended-Ward (IEC 60909).
Usage : Extended-Ward is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange.

contents.name: EquivalentInjection_x2
contents.description:
Negative sequence reactance. Used to represent Extended-Ward (IEC 60909).
Usage : Extended-Ward is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange.

contents.name: IdentifiedObject_description
contents.description: The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

contents.name: IdentifiedObject_mRID
contents.description:
Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is globally unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID,  as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID.  The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552 Edition 1, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

contents.name: IdentifiedObject_name
contents.description: The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

contents.name: IdentifiedObject_energyIdentCodeEic
contents.description:
The attribute is used for an exchange of the EIC code (Energy identification Code). The length of the string is 16 characters as defined by the EIC code.
References:

contents.name: IdentifiedObject_shortName
contents.description: The attribute is used for an exchange of a human readable short name with length of the string 12 characters maximum.
